name: GetFilteredTeamTasks
description:
Retrieve tasks from a workspace based on specified filters.

This tool retrieves tasks from a specified workspace that meet certain criteria. The response is limited to 100 tasks per page, and only tasks that the user has access to are returned. The tool is useful for viewing filtered task information from multiple lists, folders, or spaces.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The ID of the workspace to retrieve tasks from. Must be an integer.

value_schema.description: Workspace ID

parameters.name: page_number_to_fetch
parameters.description: Page number to fetch, starting at 0, in the paginated list of tasks.

value_schema.description: Page to fetch (starts at 0).

parameters.name: order_tasks_by
parameters.description: Specify the field by which to order tasks. Options include: 'id', 'created', 'updated', 'due_date'. Defaults to 'created'.

value_schema.description:
Order by a particular field. By default, tasks are ordered by `created`.\
 \
Options include: `id`, `created`, `updated`, and `due_date`.

parameters.name: filter_by_space_ids
parameters.description: An array of space IDs to filter tasks by. Example values: ['1234', '6789'].

value_schema.description:
Filter by Spaces. For example: \
 \
`?space_ids[]=1234&space_ids[]=6789`

parameters.name: filter_by_project_ids
parameters.description: An array of folder IDs to filter tasks by specific folders. For example, ['1234', '6789'].

value_schema.description:
Filter by Folders. For example: \
 \
`?project_ids[]=1234&project_ids[]=6789`

parameters.name: filter_by_list_ids
parameters.description: An array of list IDs to filter tasks by. Example: ["1234", "6789"].

value_schema.description:
Filter by Lists. For example: \
 \
`?list_ids[]=1234&list_ids[]=6789`

parameters.name: status_filters
parameters.description: Filter tasks by their statuses. Use '%20' for spaces. Example: ['to%20do', 'in%20progress'].

value_schema.description:
Filter by statuses. Use `%20` to represent a space character. To include closed tasks, use the `include_closed` parameter. \
 \
For example: \
 \
`?statuses[]=to%20do&statuses[]=in%20progress`

parameters.name: assignee_ids
parameters.description: Filter tasks by assignee using their ClickUp user IDs.

value_schema.description:
Filter by Assignees using people's ClickUp user id. For example: \
 \
`?assignees[]=1234&assignees[]=5678`

parameters.name: filter_by_tags
parameters.description: Filter tasks by tags. Use `%20` for spaces within tags. Example: `urgent%20task`.

value_schema.description:
Filter by tags. User `%20` to represent a space character. For example: \
 \
`?tags[]=tag1&tags[]=this%20tag`

parameters.name: due_date_greater_than
parameters.description: Filter tasks by a due date greater than the specified Unix time in milliseconds.

value_schema.description: Filter by due date greater than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: due_date_before
parameters.description: Filter tasks with due dates earlier than the specified Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

value_schema.description: Filter by due date less than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter_created_date_after
parameters.description: Filter tasks by creation date greater than the specified Unix time in milliseconds.

value_schema.description: Filter by date created greater than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter_by_date_created_before
parameters.description: Filter tasks created before this date. Specify as Unix time in milliseconds.

value_schema.description: Filter by date created less than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter_by_updated_date_greater_than
parameters.description: Filter tasks by their updated date, greater than the specified Unix time in milliseconds.

value_schema.description: Filter by date updated greater than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter_by_update_date_before
parameters.description: Filter tasks updated before a specific date, provided as Unix time in milliseconds.

value_schema.description: Filter by date updated less than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter_by_date_done_after
parameters.description: Filter tasks by the completion date after the given Unix time in milliseconds.

value_schema.description: Filter by date done greater than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter_by_done_date_before
parameters.description: Filter tasks completed before a specific date. Provide the date in Unix time (milliseconds).

value_schema.description: Filter by date done less than Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter_by_custom_fields
parameters.description: Include tasks with specific values in Custom Fields. Provide an array of objects with field_id, operator, and value keys.

value_schema.description:
Include tasks with specific values in one or more Custom Fields. Custom Relationships are included.\
 \
For example: `?custom_fields=[{"field_id":"abcdefghi12345678","operator":"=","value":"1234"}{"field_id":"jklmnop123456","operator":"<","value":"5"}]`\
 \
Only set Custom Field values display in the `value` property of the `custom_fields` parameter. The `=` operator isn't supported with Label Custom Fields.\
 \
Learn more about [filtering using Custom Fields.](doc:taskfilters)

parameters.name: parent_task_id
parameters.description: Include the parent task ID to return subtasks in the response.

value_schema.description: Include the parent task ID to return subtasks.

parameters.name: custom_task_type_filters
parameters.description: Filter tasks by custom task types. Use `0` for tasks, `1` for Milestones, and other numbers for Workspace-defined types.

value_schema.description:
Filter by custom task types. For example: \
 \
`?custom_items[]=0&custom_items[]=1300` \
 \
Including `0` returns tasks. Including `1` returns Milestones. Including any other number returns the custom task type as defined in your Workspace.

parameters.name: display_tasks_in_reverse_order
parameters.description: Set to true to display tasks in reverse order.

value_schema.description: Tasks are displayed in reverse order.

parameters.name: include_subtasks
parameters.description: Set to true to include subtasks, or false to exclude them. Defaults to false (exclude).

value_schema.description: Include or exclude subtasks. By default, subtasks are excluded.

parameters.name: include_closed_tasks
parameters.description: Set to true to include closed tasks, false to exclude them. By default, closed tasks are excluded.

value_schema.description:
Include or excluse closed tasks. By default, they are excluded.\
 \
To include closed tasks, use `include_closed: true`.

parameters.name: include_markdown_description
parameters.description: Set to true to return task descriptions in Markdown format. Default is false.

value_schema.description: To return task descriptions in Markdown format, use `?include_markdown_description=true`.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the clickup API.

parameters.description: Page to fetch (starts at 0).

value_schema.description: Page to fetch (starts at 0).
